p: Fungal biomass assessed through ergosterol content in the CWD was significantly affected by decay length in both tree species ( Figure 1D). The youngest CWD had the lowest ergosterol contents (14.1 ± 2.7 µg g −1 in Abies and 11.9 ± 2.0 µg g −1 in Fagus). In Abies, the ergosterol content slowly increased in the older decay classes up to a maximal average of 57.6 ± 13.3 µg g −1 for CWD in the >40 class. In Fagus, the ergosterol content strongly increased in CWD in the 7–19 class, stabilizing at approximately 120 µg g −1 ( Figure 1D).
